method.name: concat
method.summary: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).

params.param: Arrays and/or values to concatenate to the resulting array.

method.name: join
method.summary: Joins all elements of an array into a string.

params.param: Specifies a string to separate each element of the array. The separator is converted to a string if necessary. If omitted, the array elements are separated with a comma.

method.name: pop
method.summary: Removes the last element from an array and returns that element.

method.name: push
method.summary: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.

params.param: The elements to add to the end of the array.

method.name: reverse
method.summary: Reverses an array in place. The first array element becomes the last and the last becomes the first.

method.name: shift
method.summary: Removes the first element from an array and returns that element. This method changes the length of the array.

method.name: slice
method.summary: Returns a one-level deep copy of a portion of an array.

params.param: Zero-based index at which to begin extraction. As a negative index, start indicates an offset from the end of the sequence. slice(-2) extracts the second-to-last element and the last element in the sequence.

Zero-based index at which to end extraction. slice extracts up to but not including end. slice(1,4) extracts the second element through the fourth element (elements indexed 1, 2, and 3). As a negative index, end indicates an offset from the end of the sequence. slice(2,-1) extracts the third element through the second-to-last element in the sequence. If end is omitted, slice extracts to the end of the sequence.

method.name: sort
method.summary: Sorts the elements of an array in place.

params.param: Specifies a function that defines the sort order. If omitted, the array is sorted lexicographically (in dictionary order) according to the string conversion of each element.

method.name: splice
method.summary: Changes the content of an array, adding new elements while removing old elements.
method.syntax: array.splice(index, howMany, [element1][, ..., elementN]); array.splice(index, [howMany, [element1][, ..., elementN]]); // SpiderMonkey extension

params.param: Index at which to start changing the array. If negative, will begin that many elements from the end.

An integer indicating the number of old array elements to remove. If howMany is 0, no elements are removed. In this case, you should specify at least one new element. If no howMany parameter is specified (second syntax above, which is a SpiderMonkey extension), all elements after index are removed.
The elements to add to the array. If you don't specify any elements, splice simply removes elements from the array.

method.name: toSource
method.summary: Returns a string representing the source code of the array.

method.name: toString
method.summary: Returns a string representing the specified array and its elements.

method.name: unshift
method.summary: Adds one or more elements to the beginning of an array and returns the new length of the array.

params.param: The elements to add to the front of the array.

method.name: every
method.summary: Tests whether all elements in the array pass the test implemented by the provided function.

params.param: Function to test for each element.
Object to use as this when executing callback.

method.name: filter
method.summary: Creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.

params.param: Function to test each element of the array.
Object to use as this when executing callback.

method.name: forEach
method.summary: Executes a provided function once per array element.

params.param: Function to execute for each element.
Object to use as this when executing callback.

method.name: indexOf
method.summary: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

params.param: Element to locate in the array.

The index at which to begin the search. Defaults to 0, i.e. the whole array will be searched. If the index is greater than or equal to the length of the array, -1 is returned, i.e. the array will not be searched. If negative, it is taken as the offset from the end of the array. Note that even when the index is negative, the array is still searched from front to back. If the calculated index is less than 0, the whole array will be searched.

method.name: lastIndexOf
method.summary: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present. The array is searched backwards, starting at fromIndex.

params.param: Element to locate in the array.

The index at which to start searching backwards. Defaults to the array's length, i.e. the whole array will be searched. If the index is greater than or equal to the length of the array, the whole array will be searched. If negative, it is taken as the offset from the end of the array. Note that even when the index is negative, the array is still searched from back to front. If the calculated index is less than 0, -1 is returned, i.e. the array will not be searched.

method.name: map
method.summary: Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in this array.

params.param: Function that produces an element of the new Array from an element of the current one.
Object to use as this when executing callback.

method.name: some
method.summary: Tests whether some element in the array passes the test implemented by the provided function.

params.param: Function to test for each element.
Object to use as this when executing callback.

method.name: reduce
method.summary: Apply a function against an accumulator and each value of the array (from left-to-right) as to reduce it to a single value.

params.param: Function to execute on each value in the array.
Object to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

method.name: reduceRight
method.summary: Apply a function simultaneously against two values of the array (from right-to-left) as to reduce it to a single value.

params.param: Function to execute on each value in the array.
Object to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

method.name: __defineGetter__
method.summary: Binds an object's property to a function to be called when that property is looked up.

params.param: a string containing the name of the property to bind to the given function
a function to be bound to a lookup of the specified property

method.name: __defineSetter__
method.summary: Binds an object's property to a function to be called when an attempt is made to set that property.

params.param: a string containing the name of the property to be bound to the given function

a function to be called when there is an attempt to set the specified property. This function takes the form function (val) { . . . } val an alias for the variable that holds the value attempted to be assigned to prop

method.name: __lookupGetter__
method.summary: Return the function bound as a getter to the specified property.

params.param: a string containing the name of the property whose getter should be returned

method.name: __lookupSetter__
method.summary: Return the function bound as a setter to the specified property.

params.param: a string containing the name of the property whose setter should be returned

method.name: hasOwnProperty
method.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether the object has the specified property.

params.param: The name of the property to test.

method.name: isPrototypeOf
method.summary: Tests for an object in another object's prototype chain.

params.param: an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the object argument Note: isPrototypeOf differs from instanceof operator. In the expression object instanceof AFunction, the object prototype chain is checked against AFunction.prototype, not against AFunction itself
the object whose prototype chain will be searched

method.name: toSource
method.summary: Returns a string representing the source code of the object.

method.name: toString
method.summary: Returns a string representing the object.

method.name: toLocaleString
method.summary: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overriden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes.

method.name: watch
method.summary: Watches for a property to be assigned a value and runs a function when that occurs.

params.param: The name of a property of the object.
A function to call.

method.name: unwatch
method.summary: Removes a watchpoint set with the watch method.

params.param: The name of a property of the object.

method.name: valueOf
method.summary: Returns the primitive value of the specified object

method.name: getPrototypeOf
method.summary: Returns the prototype of the specified object.

params.param: The object whose prototype is to be returned.

method.name: create
method.summary: Creates a new object with the specified prototype object and properties.

params.param: The object which should be the prototype of the newly-created object.

If specified and not undefined, an object whose enumerable own properties (that is, those properties defined upon itself and not enumerable properties along its prototype chain) specify property descriptors to be added to the newly-created object, with the corresponding property names.

method.name: defineProperty
method.summary: Defines a new property directly on an object, or modifies an existing property on an object, and returns the object.

params.param: The object on which to define the property.
The name of the property to be defined or modified.
The descriptor for the property being defined or modified.

method.name: defineProperties
method.summary: Defines new or modifies existing properties directly on an object, returning the object.

params.param: The object on which to define or modify properties.
An object whose own enumerable properties constitute descriptors for the properties to be defined or modified.

method.name: getOwnPropertyDescriptor
method.summary: Returns a property descriptor for an own property (that is, one directly present on an object, not present by dint of being along an object's prototype chain) of a given object.

params.param: The object in which to look for the property.
The name of the property whose description is to be retrieved

method.name: keys
method.summary: Returns an array of all enumerable properties found directly upon a given object, in the same order as that provided by a for (var p in o) loop.

params.param: The object whose enumerable own properties are to be returned.

method.name: getOwnPropertyNames
method.summary: Returns an array of all enumerable and non-enumerable properties found directly upon a given object.

params.param: The object whose enumerable own properties are to be returned.

method.name: charAt
method.summary: Returns the specified character from a string.

params.param: An integer between 0 and 1 less than the length of the string.

method.name: charCodeAt
method.summary: Returns the numeric Unicode value of the character at the given index.

params.param: An integer greater than 0 and less than the length of the string; if it is not a number, it defaults to 0.

method.name: concat
method.summary: Combines the text of two or more strings and returns a new string.

params.param: Strings to concatenate to this string.

method.name: indexOf
method.summary: Returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, starting the search at fromIndex, returns -1 if the value is not found.

params.param: A string representing the value to search for.
The location within the calling string to start the search from. It can be any integer between 0 and the length of the string. The default value is 0.

method.name: lastIndexOf
method.summary: Returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found. The calling string is searched backward, starting at fromIndex.

params.param: A string representing the value to search for.

The location within the calling string to start the search from, indexed from left to right. It can be any integer between 0 and the length of the string. The default value is the length of the string.

method.name: localeCompare
method.summary: Returns a number indicating whether a reference string comes before or after or is the same as the given string in sort order.

params.param: The string against which the referring string is comparing

method.name: match
method.summary: Used to retrieve the matches when matching a string against a regular expression.

params.param: A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using new RegExp(obj).

method.name: quote
method.summary: Wraps the string in double quotes ("""). Will backslash any double quotes already in the string. Has no effect on single quotes.

method.name: replace
method.summary: Returns a new string with some or all matches of a pattern replaced by a replacement. The pattern can be a string or a RegExp, and the replacement can be a string or a function to be called for each match.

params.param: A RegExp object. The match is replaced by the return value of parameter.
A String that is to be replaced by newSubStr.
The String that replaces the substring received from parameter #1. A number of special replacement patterns are supported; see the "Specifying a string as a parameter" section below.

A function to be invoked to create the new substring (to put in place of the substring received from parameter #1). The arguments supplied to this function are described in the "Specifying a function as a parameter" section below.
A string containing any combination of the RegExp flags:g //global match: i //ignore case: m//match over multiple lines: y //sticky

method.name: search
method.summary: Executes the search for a match between a regular expression and this String object.

params.param: A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using new RegExp(obj).

method.name: slice
method.summary: Extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.

params.param: The zero-based index at which to begin extraction.
The zero-based index at which to end extraction. If omitted, slice extracts to the end of the string.

method.name: split
method.summary: Splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.

params.param: Specifies the character to use for separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular expression. If separator is omitted, the array returned contains one element consisting of the entire string.
Integer specifying a limit on the number of splits to be found.

method.name: substr
method.summary: Returns the characters in a string beginning at the specified location through the specified number of characters.

params.param: Location at which to begin extracting characters.
The number of characters to extract.

method.name: substring
method.summary: Returns a subset of a string between one index and another, or through the end of the string.

params.param: An integer between 0 and one less than the length of the string.
(optional) An integer between 0 and the length of the string.

method.name: toLocaleLowerCase
method.summary: Returns the calling string value converted to lower case, according to any locale-specific case mappings.

method.name: toLocaleUpperCase
method.summary: Returns the calling string value converted to upper case, according to any locale-specific case mappings.

method.name: toLowerCase
method.summary: Returns the calling string value converted to lowercase.

method.name: toSource
method.summary: Returns a string representing the source code of the object.

method.name: toString
method.summary: Returns a string representing the specified object.

method.name: toUpperCase
method.summary: Returns the calling string value converted to uppercase.

method.name: trim
method.summary: Removes whitespace from both ends of the string.

method.name: trimLeft
method.summary: Removes whitespace from the left end of the string.

method.name: trimRight
method.summary: Removes whitespace from the right end of the string.

method.name: valueOf
method.summary: Returns the primitive value of a String object.

method.name: toSource
method.summary: Returns a string representing the source code of the object.

method.name: toString
method.summary: Returns a string representing the specified Number object

params.param: An integer between 2 and 36 specifying the base to use for representing numeric values.

method.name: toLocaleString
method.summary: This method available to numbers will convert the number into a string which is suitable for presentation in the given locale.

method.summary: Returns the primitive value of a Number object.

method.name: toSource
method.summary: Returns a string representing the source code of the object.

method.name: toString
method.summary: Returns a string representing the specified Boolean object.

method.name: valueOf
method.summary: Returns the primitive value of a Boolean object.

method.name: now
method.summary: Returns the number of milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

method.name: parse
method.summary: Parses a string representation of a date, and returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

params.param: A string representing a date.

method.name: UTC
method.summary: Accepts the same parameters as the longest form of the constructor, and returns the number of milliseconds in a Date object since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time.
method.syntax: Date.UTC(year, month[, date[, hrs[, min[, sec[, ms]]]]]);

params.param: A year after 1900.
An integer between 0 and 11 representing the month.
An integer between 1 and 31 representing the day of the month.
An integer between 0 and 23 representing the hours.
An integer between 0 and 59 representing the minutes.
An integer between 0 and 59 representing the seconds.
An integer between 0 and 999 representing the milliseconds.

method.name: abs
method.summary: Returns the absolute value of a number.

params.param: A number.

method.summary: Returns the arccosine (in radians) of a number.

params.param: A number.

method.name: asin
method.summary: Returns the arcsine (in radians) of a number.

method.name: pow
method.summary: Returns base to the exponent power, that is, baseexponent.

params.param: The base number.
The exponent to which to raise base.

method.name: random
method.summary: Returns a pseudo-random number in the range [0,1) â€” that is, between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive). The random number generator is seeded from the current time, as in Java.

method.name: round
method.summary: Returns the value of a number rounded to the nearest integer.

params.param: A number.

method.name: sin
method.summary: Returns the sine of a number.

params.param: A number.

method.name: sqrt
method.summary: Returns the square root of a number.

method.name: parse
method.summary: Convert a JSON string into a JavaScript object

params.param: A JSON string

method.name: stringify
method.summary: Convert a JavaScript object into a JSON string

params.param: The JavaScript object to convert into a JSON string.

A function that alters the behavior of the stringification process, or an array of String and Number objects that serve as a whitelist for selecting the properties of the value object to be included in the JSON string. If this value is null or not provided, all properties of the object are included in the resulting JSON string.

A String or Number object that's used to insert white space into the output JSON string for readability purposes. If this is a Number, it indicates the number of space characters to use as white space; this number is capped at 10 if it's larger than that. Values less than 1 indicate that no space should be used. If this is a String, the string (or the first 10 characters of the string, if it's longer than that) is used as white space. If this parameter is not provided (or is null), no white space is used.

global.summary: Encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two "surrogate" characters).

global.name: encodeURIComponent
