property.name: applicationCache
property.summary: Returns a reference to the application cache object for the window.

params.param: cache is an object reference to a nsIDOMOfflineResourceList.

property.name: closed
property.summary: This property indicates whether the referenced window is closed or not.

params.param: A boolean. Possible Values: * true: The window has been closed. * false: The window is open.

property.name: content
property.summary: Returns a Window object for the primary content window.

property.name: crypto
property.summary: Returns the browser crypto object, which can then be used to manipulate various browser security features.

property.name: defaultStatus
property.summary: Gets/sets the status bar text for the given window.

params.param: sMsg ã¯ã€ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ã§ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆã§è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’å«ã‚€æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã§ã™ã€‚

property.name: document
property.summary: Returns a reference to the document contained in the window.

params.param: doc is an object reference to a document.

property.name: frameElement
property.summary: Returns the element (such as <iframe> or <object>) in which the window is embedded, or null if the window is top-level.

params.param: frameEl is the element which the window is embedded into, or null if the window is top-level.

property.name: frames
property.summary: Returns an array-like object, listing the direct sub-frames of the current window.

params.param: frameList is a list of frame objects. It is similar to an array in that it has a length property and its items can be accessed using the [i] notation.

property.name: fullScreen
property.summary: This property indicates whether the window is displayed in full screen mode or not. It is only reliable in Gecko 1.9 (Firefox 3) and later.

params.param: A boolean. Possible Values: * true: The window is in full screen mode. * false: The window is not in full screen mode.

property.name: globalStorage
property.summary: This is a global object (globalStorage) that maintains multiple private storage areas that can be used to hold data over a long period of time (e.g. over multiple pages and browser sessions).

property.name: history
property.summary: Returns a reference to the History object, which provides an interface for manipulating the browser session history (pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in).

params.param: History object.

property.name: innerHeight
property.summary: Height of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the horizontal scrollbar.

params.param: intViewportHeight stores the window.innerHeight property value.

property.name: innerWidth
property.summary: Width of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the vertical scrollbar.

params.param: intViewportWidth stores the window.innerWidth property value.

property.name: location
property.summary: Returns a Location object, which contains information about the URL of the document and provides methods for changing that URL. You can also assign to this property to load another URL.

params.param: locationObj is an object of type Location, providing information about the current URL and methods to change it.
newLocation is a Location object or a string, specifying the URL to navigate to.

property.name: mozAnimationStartTime
property.summary: Returns the time, in milliseconds since the epoch, at which animations started now should be considered to have started. This value should be used instead of, for example, Date.now(), because this value will be the same for all animations started in this window during this refresh interval, allowing them to remain in sync with one another.This also allows JavaScript-based animations to remain synchronized with CSS transitions and SMIL animations triggered during the same refresh interval.

params.param: time is the time in milliseconds since the epoch at which animations for the current window should be considered to have started.

property.name: mozInnerScreenX
property.summary: Gets the X coordinate of the top-left corner of the window's viewport, in screen coordinates.

params.param: The window.mozInnerScreenX property is a floating point, read-only value; it has no default value.

property.name: mozInnerScreenY
property.summary: Gets the Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the window's viewport, in screen coordinates.

params.param: The window.mozInnerScreenY property is a floating point, read-only value; it has no default value.

property.name: mozPaintCount
property.summary: Returns the number of times the current document has been painted to the screen in this window.

params.param: The window.mozPaintCount value is a long long, and starts at zero when the document is first created, incrementing by one each time the document is painted.

property.name: name
property.summary: Gets/sets the name of the window.

property.name: navigator
property.summary: Returns a reference to the navigator object, which can be queried for information about the application running the script.

property.name: opener
property.summary: Returns a reference to the window that opened this current window.

property.name: outerHeight
property.summary: Gets the height of the outside of the browser window. window.outerHeight represents the height of the whole browser window including toolbars and window chrome.

params.param: intWindowHeight stores the window.outerHeight property value.The window.outerHeight property is read-only; it has no default value. window.outerHeight property stores an integer representing a number of pixels.

property.name: outerWidth
property.summary: Gets the width of the outside of the browser window. window.outerWidth represents the width of the whole browser window including sidebar (if expanded), window chrome and window [re-]sizing borders/handles.

params.param: intWindowWidth stores the window.outerWidth property value.The window.outerWidth property is read-only; it has no default value. window.outerWidth property stores an integer representing a number of pixels.

property.name: scrollX
property.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled horizontally.

params.param: xpix is the number of pixels.

property.name: scrollY
property.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled vertically.

params.param: ypix is the number of pixels.

property.name: parent
property.summary: Returns a reference to the parent of the current window or subframe.If a window does not have a parent, its parent property is a reference to itself.When a window is loaded in an <iframe>, <object>, or <frame>, its parent is the window with the element embedding the window.

property.name: screen
property.summary: Returns a reference to the screen object associated with the window.

property.name: screenX
property.summary: Returns the horizontal distance of the left border of the user's browser from the left side of the screen.

params.param: lLoc is the number of pixels from the left side the screen.

property.name: screenY
property.summary: Returns the vertical distance of the top border of the user's browser from the top edge of the screen.

params.param: lLoc is the number of pixels from the top of the screen.

property.name: scrollMaxX
property.summary: Returns the maximum number of pixels that the document can be scrolled horizontally.

params.param: xpix is the number of pixels.

property.name: scrollMaxY
property.summary: Returns the maximum number of pixels that the document can be scrolled vertically.

params.param: ypix is the number of pixels.

property.name: self
property.summary: Returns an object reference to the window object.

property.name: sessionStorage
property.summary: This is a global object (sessionStorage) that maintains a storage area that's available for the duration of the page session. A page session lasts for as long as the browser is open and survives over page reloads and restores. Opening a page in a new tab or window will cause a new session to be initiated.

property.name: status
property.summary: Sets the text in the status bar at the bottom of the browser or returns the previously set text.This property does not work in default configuration of Firefox and some other browsers: setting window.status has no effect on the text displayed in the status bar. To allow scripts change the the status bar text, the user must set the dom.disable_window_status_change preference to false in the about:config screen.

property.name: top
property.summary: Returns a reference to the topmost window in the window hierarchy.

method.name: alert
method.summary: Display an alert dialog with the specified content and an OK button.

params.param: message is a string of text you want to display in the alert dialog, or, alternatively, an object that is converted into a string and displayed.

method.name: atob
method.summary: Decodes a string of data which has been encoded using base-64 encoding.

method.name: back
method.summary: Returns the window to the previous item in the history.

method.name: btoa
method.summary: Creates a base-64 encoded ASCII string from a string of binary data.

method.name: clearInterval
method.summary: Cancels repeated action which was set up using setInterval().

params.param: intervalID is the identifier of the repeated action you want to cancel. This ID is returned from setInterval().

method.name: clearTimeout
method.summary: Clears the delay set by window.setTimeout().

params.param: where timeoutID is the ID of the timeout you wish to clear, as returned by window.setTimeout().

method.name: close
method.summary: Closes the current window, or a referenced window.

method.name: confirm
method.summary: Displays a modal dialog with a message and two buttons, OK and Cancel.

params.param: result is a boolean value indicating whether OK or Cancel was selected (true means OK).
message is the string to be displayed in the dialog.

method.name: createBlobURL
method.summary: Creates a new blob URL, whose lifetime is tied to the document in the window on which it was created. The new blob URL represents the specified File object.

params.param: blobURL is the generated blob URL. The entire contents of the specified file are represented by the text of the URL.
file is a File object indicating the file to create a blob URL for.

method.name: dump
method.summary: Prints messages to the console.

method.name: escape
method.summary: Encodes a string, replacing certain characters with a hexadecimal escape sequence.

params.param: A regular string.

method.name: unescape
method.summary: Decodes a value that has been encoded in hexadecimal (e.g., a cookie).

params.param: The encoded string.

method.name: find
method.summary: Finds a string in a window.
method.syntax: window.find(aString, aCaseSensitive, aBackwards, aWrapAround, aWholeWord, aSearchInFrames, aShowDialog);

params.param: The text string for which to search.
Boolean value. If true, specifies a case-sensitive search.
Boolean. If true, specifies a backward search.
Boolean. If true, specifies a wrap around search.
Boolean. If true, specifies a whole word search.
Boolean. If true, specifies a search in frames.
Boolean. If true, specifies a show Dialog.

method.name: forward
method.summary: Moves the window one document forward in the history.

method.name: getComputedStyle
method.summary: getComputedStyle() gives the final used values of all the CSS properties of an element.

params.param: style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.
element is an element.
pseudoElt is a string specifying the pseudo-element to match. Must be null for regular elements.

method.name: getSelection
method.summary: Returns a selection object representing the range of text selected by the user.

params.param: selection is a Selection object.

method.name: home
method.summary: Returns the window to the home page.

method.name: moveBy
method.summary: Moves the current window by a specified amount.

params.param: deltaX is the amount of pixels to move the window horizontally.
deltaY is the amount of pixels to move the window vertically.

method.name: moveTo
method.summary: Moves the window to the specified coordinates.

params.param: x is the horizontal coordinate to be moved to.
y is the vertical coordinate to be moved to.

method.name: mozRequestAnimationFrame
method.summary: Tells the browser that you wish to perform an animation; this requests that the browser schedule a repaint of the window for the next animation frame.

params.param: An optional parameter specifying a function to call when it's time to update your animation for the next repaint.

method.name: open
method.summary: Creates a new secondary browser window and loads the referenced resource.

params.param: This is the reference pointing to the newly created browser window. This reference is the return value of the open() method; it will be null if for some reasons the execution did not succeed to open the window. A global variable is best used to store such reference. You can then, for example, use it to look for properties of the new window or access its methods, assuming that your main versus secondary window relationship complies with Same origin policy security requirements.
This is the URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. url can be an HTML document on the web, it can be an image file or any type of file which is supported by the browser.

This is the string that just names the new window. Such string can be used to be the target of links and forms when the target attribute of an <a> element or of a <form> is specified. This string parameter should not contain any blank space. name does not specify the title of the new window.

Optional parameter. This parameter is the string which lists the requested window features (window functionalities and toolbars) of the new browser window. This string parameter must not contain any blank space. Each requested window feature must be separated by a comma inside the character string.

method.name: openDialog
method.summary: window.openDialog is an extension to window.open. It behaves the same, except that it can optionally take one or more parameters past windowFeatures, and windowFeatures itself is treated a little differently.
method.syntax: newWindow = openDialog(url, name, features, arg1, arg2, ...);

params.param: The opened window
The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window.
The window name (optional). See window.open description for detailed information.
See window.open description for description.
The arguments to be passed to the new window (optional).

method.name: postMessage
method.summary: window.postMessage, when called, causes a MessageEvent to be dispatched at the target window when any pending script that must be executed completes (e.g. remaining event handlers if window.postMessage is called from an event handler, previously-set pending timeouts, etc.). The MessageEvent has the type message, a data property which is set to the string value of the first argument provided to window.postMessage, an origin property corresponding to the origin of the main document in the window calling window.postMessage at the time window.postMessage was called, and a source property which is the window from which window.postMessage is called. (Other standard properties of events are present with their expected values.)

params.param: A reference to another window; such a reference may be obtained, for example, using the contentWindow property of an iframe element, the object returned by window.open, or by named or numeric index on window.frames.
String data to be sent to the other window.

Specifies what the origin of otherWindow must be for the event to be dispatched, either as the literal string "*" (indicating no preference) or as a URI. If at the time the event is scheduled to be dispatched the scheme, hostname, or port of otherWindow's document does not match that provided in targetOrigin, the event will not be dispatched; only if all three match will the event be dispatched. This mechanism provides control over where messages are sent; for example, if postMessage were used to transmit a password, it would be absolutely critical that this argument be a URI whose origin is the same as the intended receiver of the message containing the password, to prevent interception of the password by a malicious third party. Always provide a specific targetOrigin, not *, if you know where the other window's document should be located. Failing to provide a specific target discloses the data you send to any interested malicious site.

method.name: print
method.summary: Opens the Print Dialog to print the current document.

method.name: prompt
method.summary: Displays a dialog with a message prompting the user to input some text.

params.param: result is a string containing the text entered by the user, or the value null.
text is a string of text to display to the user.
value is a string containing the default value displayed in the text input field. It is an optional parameter.

method.name: resizeBy
method.summary: Resizes the current window by a certain amount.

params.param: xDelta is the number of pixels to grow the window horizontally.
yDelta is the number of pixels to grow the window vertically.

method.name: resizeTo
method.summary: Dynamically resizes window.

params.param: iWidth is an integer representing the new outerWidth in pixels (including scroll bars, title bars, etc).
iHeight is an integer value representing the new outerHeight in pixels (including scroll bars, title bars, etc).

method.name: revokeBlobURL
method.summary: Releases an existing blob URL which was previously created by calling window.createBlobURL(). Call this method when you've finished using a blob URL, in order to let the browser know it doesn't need to keep the reference to the file any longer.

params.param: blogURL is the generated blog URL. The entire contents of the specified file are represented by the text of the URL.
file is a File object indicating the file to create a blob URL for.

method.name: scroll
method.summary: Scrolls the window to a particular place in the document.

params.param: x-coord is the pixel along the horizontal axis of the document that you want displayed in the upper left.
y-coord is the pixel along the vertical axis of the document that you want displayed in the upper left.

method.name: scrollBy
method.summary: Scrolls the document in the window by the given amount.

params.param: X is the offset in pixels to scroll horizontally.
Y is the offset in pixels to scroll vertically.

method.name: scrollByLines
method.summary: Scrolls the document by the given number of lines.

params.param: lines is the number of lines to scroll the document by.A positive or negative integer.

method.name: scrollByPages
method.summary: Scrolls the current document by the specified number of pages.

params.param: pages is the number of pages to scroll.A positive or negative integer.

method.name: scrollTo
method.summary: Scrolls to a particular set of coordinates in the document.

params.param: x-coord is the pixel along the horizontal axis of the document that you want displayed in the upper left.
y-coord is the pixel along the vertical axis of the document that you want displayed in the upper left.

method.name: setCursor
method.summary: Changes the cursor for the current window.

method.name: setInterval
method.summary: Calls a function repeatedly, with a fixed time delay between each call to that function.

params.param: intervalID is a unique interval ID you can pass to clearInterval().
func is the function you want to be called repeatedly.
delay is the number of milliseconds (thousandths of a second) that the setInterval() function should wait before each call to func. As with setTimeout, there is a minimum delay enforced.

method.name: setTimeout
method.summary: Executes a code snippet or a function after specified delay.

params.param: timeoutID is the ID of the timeout, which can be used later with window.clearTimeout.
func is the function you want to execute after delay milliseconds.
delay is the number of milliseconds (thousandths of a second) that the function call should be delayed by.

method.name: sizeToContent
method.summary: Sizes the window according to its content.The DOM content should be loaded when this function is called, for example after the DOMContentLoaded event.

method.name: stop
method.summary: This method stops window loading.

property.name: activeElement
property.summary: Returns the currently focused element, that is, the element that will get keystroke events if the user types any. Attribute is read only.

property.name: anchors
property.summary: anchors returns a list of all of the anchors in the document.

property.name: alinkColor
property.summary: Returns or sets the color of an active link in the document body. A link is active during the time between mousedown and mouseup events.

params.param: color is a string containing the name of the color (e.g., "blue", "darkblue", etc.) or the hexadecimal value of the color (e.g., #0000FF)

property.name: applets
property.summary: applets returns an ordered list of the applets within a document.

property.name: async
property.summary: document.async can be set to indicate whether a document.load call should be an asynchronous or synchronous request. true is the default value, indicating that documents should be loaded asynchronously.

property.name: bgColor
property.summary: bgColor gets/sets the background color of the current document.

params.param: color is a string representing the color as a word (e.g., "red") or hexadecimal value (e.g., "#ff0000").

property.name: body
property.summary: Returns the <body> or <frameset> node of the current document.

property.name: characterSet
property.summary: Returns the character encoding of the current document.

property.name: compatMode
property.summary: Indicates whether the document is rendered in Quirks mode or Strict mode.

params.param: mode is the string "BackCompat" for Quirks mode or "CSS1Compat" for Strict mode.

property.name: contentType
property.summary: Returns the Content-Type from the HTTP headers of the document.

params.param: contentType is a read-only property.

property.name: cookie
property.summary: Get and set the cookies associated with the current document.

params.param: allCookies is a string containing a semicolon-separated list of cookies (i.e. key=value pairs)

property.name: defaultView
property.summary: document.defaultView returns a reference to the default AbstractView for the document, or null if none available.

property.name: designMode
property.summary: Gets/sets WYSYWIG editing capability of Midas. It can only be used for HTML documents.

property.name: dir
property.summary: Gets/sets directionality (rtl/ltr) of the document

property.name: doctype
property.summary: Returns the Document Type Declaration (DTD) associated with current document. The returned object implements the DocumentType interface. Use DOMImplementation.createDocumentType to create a DocumentType.

params.param: doctype is a read-only property.

property.name: documentElement
property.summary: Returns the Element that is the root element of the document (for example, the <html> element for HTML documents).

property.name: documentURI
property.summary: Returns the document location.

property.name: domain
property.summary: Gets/sets the domain portion of the origin of the current document, as used by the same origin policy.

property.name: embeds
property.summary: embeds returns a list of the embedded OBJECTS within the current document.

property.name: fgColor
property.summary: fgColor gets/sets the foreground color, or text color, of the current document.

params.param: color is a string representing the color as a word (e.g., "red") or hexadecimal value (e.g., "#ff0000").

property.name: forms
property.summary: forms returns a list of the form elements within the current document.

property.name: height
property.summary: Returns the height of the body element of the current document.

params.param: height_value is the number of pixels.

property.name: images
property.summary: document.images returns a collection of the images in the current HTML document.

property.name: implementation
property.summary: Returns a DOMImplementation object associated with the current document.

property.name: inputEncoding
property.summary: Returns a string representing the encoding under which the document was parsed (e.g. ISO-8859-1).

params.param: inputEncoding is a read-only property.

property.name: lastModified
property.summary: Returns a string containing the date and time on which the current document was last modified.

property.name: linkColor
property.summary: linkColor gets/sets the color of links within the document.

params.param: color is a string representing the color as a word (e.g., "red") or hexadecimal value (e.g., "#ff0000").

property.name: width
property.summary: Returns the width of the body element of the current document in pixels.

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.summary: Returns the encoding as determined by the XML declaration. Should be null if unspecified or unknown.

property.name: links
property.summary: The links property returns a collection of all AREA elements and anchor elements in a document with a value for the href attribute.

property.name: location
property.summary: Returns a Location object, which contains information about the URL of the document and provides methods for changing that URL. In Gecko browsers you can also assign to this property to load another URL.

property.name: plugins
property.summary: Returns an HTMLCollection object containing one or more HTMLEmbedElements or null which represent the <embed> elements in the current document.

property.name: readyState
property.summary: Returns "loading" while the document is loading, and "complete" once it has loaded.

property.name: referrer
property.summary: Returns the URI of the page that linked to this page.

property.name: styleSheets
property.summary: Returns a list of stylesheet objects for stylesheets explicitly linked into or embedded in a document.

property.name: title
property.summary: Gets or sets the title of the document.

params.param: title is a string containing the document's title. If the title was overridden by setting document.title, returns that value. Otherwise returns the title specified in the markup.

property.name: URL
property.summary: Returns the URL of the current document.

property.name: vlinkColor
property.summary: Gets/sets the color of links that the user has visited in the document.

params.param: color is a string representing the color as a word (e.g., "red") or hexadecimal value (e.g., "#ff0000").

property.name: xmlVersion
property.summary: Returns the version number as specified in the XML declaration (e.g., <?xml version="1.0"?>) or "1.0" if the declaration is absent.

method.name: adoptNode
method.summary: Adopts a node from an external document. The node and its subtree is removed from the document it's in (if any), and its ownerDocument is changed to the current document. The node can then be inserted into the current document.

params.param: externalNode is the node from another document to be adopted.

method.name: clear
method.summary: This method used to clear the whole specified document in early (pre-1.0) versions of Mozilla. In recent versions of Mozilla-based applications as well as in Internet Explorer and Netscape 4 this method does nothing.

method.name: close
method.summary: The document.close() method finishes writing to a document, opened with document.open().

method.name: createAttribute
method.summary: createAttribute creates a new attribute node, and returns it.

params.param: attribute is an attribute node.
name is a string containing the name of the attribute.

method.name: createCDATASection
method.summary: createCDATASection() creates a new CDATA section node, and returns it.

params.param: CDATA Section node is a CDATA Section node.
data is a string containing the data to be added to the CDATA Section.

method.name: createComment
method.summary: createComment() creates a new comment node, and returns it.

params.param: Comment node is a Comment node.
data is a string containing the data to be added to the Comment.

method.name: createDocumentFragment
method.summary: Creates an empty document fragment.

params.param: docFragment is a reference to an empty DocumentFragment object.

method.name: createElement
method.summary: Creates an element with the specified tag name defaulting namespace depending on the document.

params.param: element is the created element object.
tagName is a string that specifies the type of element to be created. The nodeName of the created element is initialized with the value of tagName.

method.name: createElementNS
method.summary: Creates an element with the specified namespace URI and qualified name.

params.param: element is the created element.
namespaceURI is a string that specifies the namespace URI to associate with the element. The namespaceURI property of the created element is initialized with the value of namespaceURI.
qualifiedName is a string that specifies the type of element to be created. The nodeName property of the created element is initialized with the value of qualifiedName.

method.name: createEvent
method.summary: Creates an event of the type specified. The returned object should be first initialized and can then be passed to element.dispatchEvent.

params.param: event is the created Event object.
type is a string that represents the type of event to be created. Possible event types include "UIEvents", "MouseEvents", "MutationEvents", and "HTMLEvents".

method.name: createExpression
method.summary: This method compiles an XPathExpression which can then be used for (repeated) evaluations.

params.param: String
Function

method.name: createNSResolver
method.summary: Creates an XPathNSResolver which resolves namespaces with respect to the definitions in scope for a specified node.

params.param: nsResolver is an XPathNSResolver object.
node is the node to be used as a context for namespace resolution.

method.name: createProcessingInstruction
method.summary: createProcessingInstruction() creates a new processing instruction node, and returns it.

params.param: Processing Instruction node is a ProcessingInstruction node.
target refers to the target part of the processing instruction node.
data is a string containing the data to be added to the data within the node.

method.name: createRange
method.summary: Returns a new Range object.

method.name: createTextNode
method.summary: Creates a new Text node.

params.param: text is a Text node.
data is a string containing the data to be put in the text node.

method.name: createTreeWalker
method.summary: Returns a new TreeWalker object.
method.syntax: var treeWalker = document.createTreeWalker(root, whatToShow, filter, entityReferenceExpansion);

params.param: root is the root of the TreeWalker's traversal
whatToShow is one of the constant properties of NodeFilter

filter is an object with a method acceptNode, which is called by the TreeWalker to determine whether or not to accept a node. The function should return NodeFilter.FILTER_ACCEPT, NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT, or NodeFilter.FILTER_SKIP.
entityReferenceExpansion

method.name: elementFromPoint
method.summary: Returns the element from the document whose elementFromPoint method is being called which is the topmost element which lies under the given point. The point is specified via coordinates, in CSS pixels, relative to the upper-left-most point in the window or frame containing the document.

params.param: element is an element object.
x and y specify the coordinates to check, in CSS pixels relative to the upper-left corner of the document's containing window or frame.

method.name: evaluate
method.summary: Returns an XPathResult based on an XPath expression and other given parameters.
method.syntax: var xpathResult = document.evaluate(xpathExpression, contextNode, namespaceResolver, resultType, result);

params.param: xpathExpression is a string representing the XPath to be evaluated.
contextNode specifies the context node for the query. It's common to pass document as the context node.

namespaceResolver is a function that will be passed any namespace prefixes and should return a string representing the namespace URI associated with that prefix. It will be used to resolve prefixes within the XPath itself, so that they can be matched with the document. null is common for HTML documents or when no namespace prefixes are used.

resultType is an integer that corresponds to the type of result XPathResult to return. Use named constant properties, such as XPathResult.ANY_TYPE, of the XPathResult constructor, which correspond to integers from 0 to 9.
# result is an existing XPathResult to use for the results. null is the most common and will create a new XPathResult.

method.name: execCommand
method.summary: When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand will affect the currently active editable element.
method.syntax: execCommand(String aCommandName, Boolean aShowDefaultUI, String aValueArgument);

params.param: the name of the command
whether the default user interface should be shown. This is not implemented in Mozilla.
some commands (such as insertimage) require an extra value argument (the image's url). Pass an argument of null if no argument is needed.

method.name: getElementById
method.summary: Returns the element whose ID is specified.

params.param: element is an element object.
id is a case-sensitive string representing the unique ID of the element being sought.

method.name: getElementsByName
method.summary: Returns a list of elements with a given name in the HTML document.

params.param: elements is a NodeList of elements.
name is the value of the name attribute of the element.

method.name: hasFocus
method.summary: The hasFocus method returns true if the focus is currently located anywhere inside the specified document.

method.name: importNode
method.summary: Creates a copy of a node from an external document that can be inserted into the current document.

params.param: node is the new node that is imported into the document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.
externalNode is the node from another document to be imported.
deep is a boolean, indicating whether the children of the node need to be imported.

method.name: open
method.summary: The document.open() method opens a document for writing.

method.name: mozSetImageElement
method.summary: Changes the element being used as the CSS background for a background with a given background element ID.

params.param: imageElementId is a string indicating the name of an element that has been specified as a background image using the -moz-element CSS function.
imageElement is the new element to use as the background corresponding to that image element string. Specify null to remove the background element.

method.name: write
method.summary: Writes a string of text to a document stream opened by document.open().

params.param: markup is a string containing the text to be written to the document.

method.name: writeln
method.summary: Writes a string of text followed by a newline character to a document.

params.param: line is string containing a line of text.

property.name: attributes
property.summary: The .attributes NamedNodeMap is a collection of Attr nodes. The numerical order the nodes appear in may differ among implementations.

params.param: NamedNodeMap is a collection of Attr nodes.

property.name: childElementCount
property.summary: childElementCount returns the number of child elements of the given element.

params.param: elCount is the number of elements that are children of the current element. If the element has no children, then elCount is zero. This attribute is read only.

property.name: childNodes
property.summary: childNodes returns a collection of child nodes of the given element.

params.param: ndList is an ordered collection of node objects that are children of the current element. If the element has no children, then ndList contains no node.The ndList is a variable storing the node list of childNodes. Such list is of type NodeList. The childNodes attribute is read-only.

property.name: children
property.summary: children returns a collection of child elements of the given element.

params.param: elList is an ordered collection of element objects that are children of the current element. If the element has no children, then elList contains no elements.The elList is a variable storing the node list of children. Such list is of type NodeList. The children attribute is read-only.

property.name: classList
property.summary: classList returns a token list of the class attribute of the element.

params.param: elementClasses is a DOMTokenList representing the class attribute of elementNodeReference. If the class attribute was not set or is empty elementClasses.length returns 0. element.classList is read-only.

property.name: className
property.summary: className gets and sets the value of the class attribute of the specified element.

params.param: cName is a string variable representing the class or space-separated classes of the current element.

property.name: clientHeight
property.summary: Returns the inner height of an element in pixels, including padding but not the horizontal scrollbar height, border, or margin.clientHeight can be calculated as CSS height + CSS padding - height of horizontal scrollbar (if present).

params.param: h is an integer representing the clientHeight of element in pixels.clientHeight is readâ€“only.

property.name: clientLeft
property.summary: The width of the left border of an element in pixels. It includes the width of the vertical scrollbar if the text direction of the element is rightâ€“toâ€“left and if there is an overflow causing a left vertical scrollbar to be rendered. clientLeft does not include the left margin or the left padding. clientLeft is read-only.

property.name: clientTop
property.summary: The width of the top border of an element in pixels. It does not include the top margin or padding. clientTop is read-only.

property.name: clientWidth
property.summary: clientWidth is the inner width of an element in pixels. It includes padding but not the vertical scrollbar (if present, if rendered), border or margin.

params.param: intElemClientWidth is an integer corresponding to the clientWidth of element in pixels. clientWidth is readâ€“only.

property.name: contentEditable
property.summary: contentEditable is used to indicate whether or not the element is editable. An empty string or "true" indicates that the element is editable; a value of "false" indicates that the element cannot be edited, and a value of "inherit" indicates that the element inherits its parent's editable status.

property.name: dir
property.summary: The dir attribute gets or sets the text writing directionality of the content of the current element.

params.param: CurrentWritingDirection is a string variable representing the text writing direction of the current element. NewWritingDirection is a string variable representing the text writing direction value.Possible values for dir are ltr, for Left-to-right, and rtl, for Right-to-left.

property.name: firstChild
property.summary: Returns the node's first child in the tree, or null if the node is childless. If the node is a Document, it returns the first node in the list of its direct children.

params.param: childNode is a reference to the first child of node if there is one, otherwise it's null.

property.name: firstElementChild
property.summary: firstElementChild returns the element's first child element or null if there are no child elements.

params.param: childNode is a reference to the first child element of the element node, or null if there isn't one. This attribute is read-only.

property.name: id
property.summary: Gets or sets the element's identifier (attribute id).

params.param: where idStr is the ID of the element.

property.name: innerHTML
property.summary: innerHTML sets or gets the HTML syntax describing the element's descendants.

params.param: Returns a string containing the HTML syntax describing all of the element's descendants.Removes all of element's descendants, parses the content string and assigns the resulting nodes as descendants of the element.

property.name: isContentEditable
property.summary: isContentEditable returns true if the contents of the element are editable; otherwise it returns false.

property.name: lang
property.summary: This property gets or sets the base language of an element's attribute values and text content.

params.param: languageUsed is a string variable that gets the language in which the text of the current element is written. NewLanguage is a string variable with its value setting the language in which the text of the current element is written.

property.name: lastChild
property.summary: lastChild returns the last child of a node.

params.param: The last_child returned is a node. If its parent is an element, then the child is generally an Element node, a Text node, or a Comment node.

property.name: lastElementChild
property.summary: lastElementChild returns the element's last child element or null if there are no child elements.

params.param: childNode is a reference to the last child element of the element node, or null if there isn't one.This attribute is read-only.

property.name: localName
property.summary: Returns the local part of the qualified name of this node.

params.param: name is the local name as a string.

property.name: name
property.summary: name gets or sets the name attribute of an DOM object, it only applies to the following elements: <a> , <applet> , <form> , <frame> , <iframe> , <image> , <input> , <map> , <meta> , <object> , <option> , <param> , <select> , and <textarea> .
property.syntax: HTMLElement.name = string; var elName = HTMLElement.name; var fControl = HTMLFormElement.elementName; var controlCollection = HTMLFormElement.elements.elementName;

property.name: namespaceURI
property.summary: The namespace URI of the node, or null if the node is not in a namespace (read-only). When the node is a document, it returns the XML namespace for the current document.

params.param: namespace is a string that represents the namespace URI of the specified node.

property.name: nextSibling
property.summary: Returns the node immediately following the specified one in its parent's childNodes list, or null if the specified node is the last node in that list.

property.name: nextElementSibling
property.summary: nextElementSibling returns the element immediately following the specified one in its parent's children list, or null if the specified element is the last one in the list.

params.param: nextNode is a reference to the next sibling of the element node, or null if there isn't one.This attribute is read-only.

property.name: nodeName
property.summary: Returns the name of the current node as a string.

params.param: str is a string variable storing the name of the current element.nodeName is a read-only attribute.

property.name: nodeType
property.summary: Returns an integer code representing the type of the node.

property.name: nodeValue
property.summary: Returns or sets the value of the current node.

params.param: value is a string containing the value of the current node, if any.

property.name: offsetHeight
property.summary: Height of an element relative to the element's offsetParent.

params.param: intElemOffsetHeight is a variable storing an integer corresponding to the offsetHeight pixel value of the element. offsetHeight is a read-only property.

property.name: offsetLeft
property.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the upper left corner of the current element is offset to the left within the offsetParent node.

params.param: left is an integer representing the offset to the left in pixels.

property.name: offsetParent
property.summary: offsetParent returns a reference to the object which is the closest (nearest in the containment hierarchy) positioned containing element. If the element is non-positioned, the nearest table cell or root element (html in standards compliant mode; body in quirks rendering mode) is the offsetParent. offsetParent returns null when the element has style.display set to "none". The offsetParent is useful because offsetTop and offsetLeft are relative to its padding edge.

params.param: parentObj is an object reference to the element in which the current element is offset.

property.name: offsetTop
property.summary: offsetTop returns the distance of the current element relative to the top of the offsetParent node.

params.param: topPos is the number of pixels from the top of the parent element.

property.name: offsetWidth
property.summary: Returns the layout width of an element.

params.param: offsetWidth is a read-only property.

property.name: ownerDocument
property.summary: The ownerDocument property returns the top-level document object for this node.

params.param: doc is the document object parent of the current element.

property.name: parentNode
property.summary: Returns the parent of the specified node in the DOM tree.

params.param: parentNode is the parent of the current node. The parent of an element is an Element node, a Document node, or a DocumentFragment node.

property.name: prefix
property.summary: prefix returns the namespace prefix of the specified node, or null if no prefix is specified.

property.name: previousSibling
property.summary: Returns the node immediately preceding the specified one in its parent's childNodes list, null if the specified node is the first in that list.

property.name: previousElementSibling
property.summary: previousElementSibling returns the element immediately prior to the specified one in its parent's children list, or null if the specified element is the first one in the list.

params.param: prevNode is a reference to the previous sibling of the element node, or null if there isn't one.This attribute is read-only.

property.name: scrollHeight
property.summary: Height of the scroll view of an element; it includes the element padding but not its margin.

params.param: intElemScrollHeight is a variable storing an integer corresponding to the scrollHeight pixel value of the element. scrollHeight is a read-only property.

property.name: scrollLeft
property.summary: scrollLeft gets or sets the number of pixels that an element's content is scrolled to the left.

params.param: sLeft is an integer representing the number of pixels that element has been scrolled to the left.

property.name: scrollTop
property.summary: scrollTop gets or sets the number of pixels that the content of an element is scrolled upward.

params.param: intElemScrollTop is an integer corresponding to number of pixels that element's content has been scrolled upward.

property.name: scrollWidth
property.summary: scrollWidth is a readâ€“only property that returns either the width in pixels of the content of an element or the width of the element itself, whichever is greater. If the element is wider than its content area (for example, if there are scroll bars for scrolling through the content), the scrollWidth is larger than the clientWidth.

params.param: xScrollWidth is the width of the content of element in pixels.

property.name: style
property.summary: Returns an object that represents the element's style attribute.

property.name: tabIndex
property.summary: Gets/sets the tab order of the current element.

params.param: iIndex is a number;

property.name: tagName
property.summary: Returns the name of the element.

params.param: elementName is a string containing the name of the current element.

property.name: textContent
property.summary: Gets or sets the text content of a node and its descendants.
property.syntax: var text = element.textContent; element.textContent = "this is some sample text";

property.name: title
property.summary: Establishes the text to be displayed in a 'tool tip' popup when the mouse is over the displayed node.

method.name: addEventListener
method.summary: addEventListener registers a single event listener on a single target. The event target may be a single node in a document, the document itself, a window, or an XMLHttpRequest.To register more than one event listeners for the target, call addEventListener for the same target but with different event types or capture parameters.

params.param: A string representing the event type to listen for.
The object that receives a notification when an event of the specified type occurs. This must be an object implementing the EventListener interface, or simply a JavaScript function.

If true, useCapture indicates that the user wishes to initiate capture. After initiating capture, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered listener before being dispatched to any EventTargets beneath it in the DOM tree. Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger a listener designated to use capture.

method.name: appendChild
method.summary: Adds a node to the end of the list of children of a specified parent node. If the node already exists it is removed from current parent node, then added to new parent node.

params.param: element is the parent element.
child is the node to append underneath element. Also returned.

method.name: cloneNode
method.summary: Returns a duplicate of the current node.

params.param: deep is a required boolean value indicating whether the clone is a deep clone or not.

method.name: compareDocumentPosition
method.summary: Compares the position of the current node against another node in any other document.

params.param: node is the node that's being compared.
otherNode is the node that's being compared against.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.summary: Dispatches an event into the event system. The event is subject to the same capturing and bubbling behavior as directly dispatched events.

params.param: element is the target of the event.
event is an event object to be dispatched.
The return value is false, if at least one of the event handlers which handled this event, called preventDefault. Otherwise it returns true.

method.name: getAttribute
method.summary: getAttribute() returns the value of the named attribute on the specified element. If the named attribute does not exist, the value returned will either be null or "" (the empty string);

params.param: attribute is a string containing the value of attributeName.
attributeName is the name of the attribute whose value you want to get.

method.name: getAttributeNS
method.summary: getAttributeNS returns the string value of the attribute with the specified namespace and name. If the named attribute does not exist, the value returned will either be null or "" (the empty string);

params.param: attrVal is the string value of the specified attribute.
namespace is the namespace of the specified attribute.
name is the name of the specified attribute.

method.name: getAttributeNode
method.summary: Returns the specified attribute of the specified element, as an Attr node.

params.param: attrNode is an Attr node for the attribute.
attrName is a string containing the name of the attribute.

method.name: getAttributeNodeNS
method.summary: Returns the Attr node for the attribute with the given namespace and name.

params.param: attributeNode is the node for specified attribute.
namespace is a string specifying the namespace of the attribute.
nodeName is a string specifying the name of the attribute.

method.name: getBoundingClientRect
method.summary: Returns a text rectangle object that encloses a group of text rectangles.

method.name: getClientRects
method.summary: Returns a collection of rectangles that indicate the bounding rectangles for each box in a client.

method.name: getElementsByClassName
method.summary: Returns a set of elements which have all the given class names. When called on the document object, the complete document is searched, including the root node. You may also call getElementsByClassName on any element; it will return only elements which are descendants of the specified root element with the given class names.

params.param: elements is a live NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.
names is a string representing the list of class names to match; class names are separated by whitespace.

method.name: getElementsByTagName
method.summary: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name. The subtree underneath the specified element is searched, excluding the element itself.

params.param: elements is a live NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the subtree.
element is the element from where the search should start. Note that only the descendants of this element are included in the search, but not the element itself.
tagName is the qualified name to look for. The special string "*" represents all elements. For compatibility with XHTML, lower-case should be used.

method.name: getElementsByTagNameNS
method.summary: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name belonging to the given namespace.

params.param: elements is a live NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.
element is the element from where the search should start. Note that only the descendants of this element are included in the search, not the node itself.
namespaceURI is the namespace URI of elements to look for. For example, if you need to look for XHTML elements, use the XHTML namespace URI, http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml.
localName is either the local name of elements to look for or the special value "*", which matches all elements.

method.name: getUserData
method.summary: Returns any user data set previously on the given node by setUserData().

params.param: userData is the data that had been stored previously by setUserData() or null if none.
someNode is the node for which user data is being sought.
userKey is the key to choose the specific data sought for the given node. More than one key may have been assigned on a given node, containing its own value.

method.name: hasAttribute
method.summary: hasAttribute returns a boolean value indicating whether the specified element has the specified attribute or not.

params.param: result holds the return value true or false.
attName is a string representing the name of the attribute.

method.name: hasAttributeNS
method.summary: hasAttributeNS returns a boolean value indicating whether the current element has the specified attribute.

params.param: result is the boolean value true or false.
namespace is a string specifying the namespace of the attribute.
localName is the name of the attribute.

method.name: hasAttributes
method.summary: hasAttributes returns a boolean value of true or false, indicating if the current element has any attributes or not.

method.name: hasChildNodes
method.summary: hasChildNodes returns a Boolean value indicating whether the current element has child nodes or not.

method.name: insertBefore
method.summary: Inserts the specified node before a reference element as a child of the current node.

params.param: insertedElement The node being inserted, that is newElement
parentElement The parent of the newly inserted node.
newElement The node to insert.
referenceElement The node before which newElement is inserted.

method.name: isDefaultNamespace
method.summary: isDefaultNamespace accepts a namespace URI as an argument and returns true if the namespace is the default namespace on the given node or false if not.

params.param: result holds the return value true or false.
namespaceURI is a string representing the namespace against which the element will be checked.

method.name: isSupported
method.summary: Tests whether the DOM implementation implements a specific feature and that feature is supported by this node.

params.param: feature The name of the feature to test. This is the same name which can be passed to the method hasFeature on DOMImplementation.

version This is the version number of the feature to test. In DOM Level 2, version 1, this is the string 2.0. If the version is not specified, supporting any version of the feature will cause the method to return true.

method.name: mozMatchesSelector
method.summary: Returns true if the element would be selected by the specified selector string; otherwise, returns false.

params.param: result holds the return value true or false.
selectorString is a string representing the selector to test.

method.name: normalize
method.summary: Puts the specified node and all of its subtree into a "normalized" form. In a normalized subtree, no text nodes in the subtree are empty and there are no adjacent text nodes.

method.name: querySelector
method.summary: Returns the first element that is a descendent of the element on which it is invoked that matches the specified group of selectors.

params.param: element and baseElement are element objects.
selectors is a group of selectors to match on.

method.name: querySelectorAll
method.summary: Returns a list of all elements descended from the element on which it is invoked that match the specified group of selectors.

params.param: elementList is a non-live list of element objects.
baseElement is an element object.
selectors is a group of selectors to match on.

method.name: removeAttribute
method.summary: removeAttribute removes an attribute from the specified element.

params.param: attrName is a string that names the attribute to be removed from element.

method.name: removeAttributeNS
method.summary: removeAttributeNS removes the specified attribute from an element.

params.param: namespace is a string that contains the namespace of the attribute.
attrName is a string that names the attribute to be removed from the current node.

method.name: removeAttributeNode
method.summary: removeAttributeNode removes the specified attribute from the current element.

params.param: removedAttr is the removed Attr node.
attributeNode is the Attr node that needs to be removed.

method.name: removeChild
method.summary: Removes a child node from the DOM. Returns removed node.

params.param: oldChild holds a reference to the removed child node. oldChild == child.
element is the parent node of child.
child is the child node to be removed from the DOM.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.summary: removeEventListener allows the removal of event listeners from the event target.

params.param: A string representing the event type being removed.
The listener parameter indicates the EventListener function to be removed.

Specifies whether the EventListener being removed was registered as a capturing listener or not. If a listener was registered twice, one with capture and one without, each must be removed separately. Removal of a capturing listener does not affect a non-capturing version of the same listener, and vice versa.

method.name: replaceChild
method.summary: Replaces one child node of the specified element with another.

params.param: replacedNode is the replaced node. This is the same node as oldChild.
newChild is the new node to replace oldChild. If it already exists in the DOM, it is first removed.
oldChild is the existing child to be replaced.

method.name: scrollIntoView
method.summary: The scrollIntoView method scrolls the element into view.

params.param: alignWithTop is an optional boolean that if set to true, aligns the scrolled element with the top of the scroll area. If false, it is aligned with the bottom.

method.name: setAttribute
method.summary: Adds a new attribute or changes the value of an existing attribute on the specified element.

params.param: name is the name of the attribute as a string.
value is the desired new value of the attribute.

method.name: setAttributeNS
method.summary: setAttributeNS adds a new attribute or changes the value of an attribute with the given namespace and name.

params.param: namespace is a string specifying the namespace of the attribute.
name is a string identifying the attribute to be set.
value is the desired string value of the new attribute.

method.name: setAttributeNode
method.summary: setAttributeNode() adds a new Attr node to the specified element.

params.param: replacedAttr is the replaced attribute node, if any, returned by this function.
attribute is the Attr node to set on the element.

method.name: setAttributeNodeNS
method.summary: setAttributeNodeNS adds a new namespaced attribute node to an element.

params.param: replacedAttr is the replaced attribute node, if any, returned by this function.
attributeNode is an Attr node.

method.name: setUserData
method.summary: Allows a user to attach data to an element, without needing to modify the DOM. Note that such data will not be preserved when imported via importNode, as with cloneNode() and renameNode() operations (though adoptNode does preserve the information), and equality tests in isEqualNode() do not consider user data in making the assessment.

params.param: prevUserData is the user data previously stored on the node, and null if none.
someNode is a node, such as an element.
userKey is used as the key by which one may subsequently obtain the stored data. More than one key can be set for a given node.

handler is a callback which will be called any time the node is being cloned, imported, renamed, as well as if deleted or adopted; a function can be used or an object implementing the handle method (part of the UserDataHandler interface). The handler will be passed five arguments: an operation type integer (e.g., 1 to indicate a clone operation), the user key, the data on the node, the source node (null if being deleted), the destination node (the newly created node or null if none).If no handler is desired, one must specify null.
